intro: Eremogone asiatica, commonly known as the Asian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, often clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to dry, hot climates. Eremogone asiatica is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
